intro: Cussonia triptera, commonly known as the African arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its large, arrow-shaped leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that are typically hidden within a spathe. Its rhizomes are edible and have been traditionally used as a starch source. Cussonia triptera thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
